metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26116 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
http.client in Python 3.x before 3.5.10, 3.6.x before 3.6.12, 3.7.x before 3.7.9, and 3.8.x before 3.8.5 allows CRLF injection if the attacker controls the HTTP request method, as demonstrated by inserting CR and LF control characters in the first argument of HTTPConnection.request.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26116` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.3
libpython3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.3
libpython3.6-minimal - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.3
libpython3.6-stdlib - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.3
libpython3.6-testsuite - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.3
python3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.3
python3.6-examples - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.3
python3.6-minimal - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.3
python3.6-venv - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python3.6 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.3').
python3.7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
python3.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
